posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Just to fill in the requirement Empyre was referring to: an SR of 67 makes any character immune to all spells that require a spell resistance check.  There is nothing to be gained by reaching higher ratings than that number because monk SR cannot be lowered by breaches or druid's Nature's Balance.  Curse Song has no effect on SR either.

SR 67 target is, historically, a near-pure, dedicated SR monk build although there are possibilities to multiclass a bit and still achieve that goal.  There are yet some spells like Creeping Doom and dispels that override all spell resistance protection.  A level of SR 40 is not too difficult to achieve via monk hybrid so there are plenty of secondary alternatives available including DevCrit and ED builds (and probably even CHA-based DM/DS ones, though I haven't pursued them... yet).
